comments.body:
It looks like the rake task to remove them from the database was not run - see https://github.com/pulibrary/approvals/blob/main/docs/leaving_princeton.md for documentation.

I've run the rake task on both the staging and production servers, so they should now be removed.

lae-blacklight.title: Use new blacklight search results api for indexing
lae is not getting updated metadata

comments.body: the rabbitmq queue is back but the reindex script is broken. it's because of the blacklight json api changes (see e.g. https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/issues/5287 and https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/5316)

lae-blacklight.title: Add how long it takes to reindex

orangelight.title: Add pending test for CSRF protection
[Orangelight/production] URI::InvalidURIError: URI must be ascii only "https://bibdata.princeton.edu/patron/22101002361913\u202C"

comments.body: The alma login does not use the bibdata API, but uses the Alma gem to authenticate the user. The username is also being url encoded (we ran into an issue earlier this year with spaces in the alma usernames, which can occur - see https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/issues/3046)
What's being put in the database is not what the user inputs, but what is returned from Alma, so I think we don't need to do anything further with this.

princeton_ansible.title: ensure the os update does a reboot

comments.body:
When trying to build the application locally on [main](https://github.com/pulibrary/recap/tree/20b2aa2e80a1ab22860a3cb470e43c0442746349), we (@kevinreiss and I) are hitting the same error:

```
[Tue Oct 11 20:03:01.778377 2022] [php7:notice] [pid 5132] [client 172.19.0.2:46996] Uncaught PHP Exception Drupal\\Core\\Extension\\Exception\\UnknownExtensionException: "The module  does not exist or is not installed." at /app/core/lib/Drupal/Core/Extension/ExtensionList.php line 347, referer: http://recap.lndo.site/
```

Note the double space between "module" and "does", where the name of the module should be. 

Kevin cloned production to the staging server, and did not run into this error. It's unclear what the issue is, but our best guess is that it has to do with the migration from Drupal 8 to Drupal 9, and the subsequent shift in configuration management, having to do with using the database versus yaml files.

princeton_ansible.title: Move RePEc to ansible managed server

comments.body:
@maxkadel and I investigated this at length today.  Unfortunately, the Drupal 7 date_ical module relies on a very outdated version of the iCalcreator library, which is not compatible with PHP 8.

For context:

- The [date_ical module documentation](https://git.drupalcode.org/project/date_ical/-/blob/7.x-3.x/README.txt) says: "The author of iCalcreator made extenside backwards incompatible changes to the
library in the v2.22 release. Thus Date iCal does not support any version of
iCalcreator after v2.20.x."
- PHP 8 support is not mentioned in the iCalcreator release notes until https://github.com/iCalcreator/iCalcreator/blob/master/releaseNotes#L132-L155

The results on PHP 8 are:

- With iCalcreator 2.20.2 (the version currently in main), the libcal importer fails with an error about the curly brace array syntax (e.g. `$array{0}`)
- With iCalcreator 2.20.4, the libcal importer hangs for several minutes, before giving a database timeout error

pulfalight.title: Make search bar autocomplete text invisible
Address exception raised by DAO with incorrectly formatted link
Make autocomplete text invisible in search bar

comments.body:
The CSS ways of doing this had undesirable accessibility side effects. Either we could hide the autocompleted text visually but not from screen readers, or we could effectively hide it but it also hid the search bar from screen readers.

It looks like there's a `hint` option on the typeahead initialization that is set to "true" in blacklight. It seems worth trying to override that initialization and set it to false instead.

https://github.com/twitter/typeahead.js/blob/master/doc/jquery_typeahead.md

I would try copying most of https://github.com/projectblacklight/blacklight/blob/v7.29.0/app/javascript/blacklight/autocomplete.js into pulfalight_loader.es6 to see if we can initialize it with the hint off.

Also, an interesting note, blacklight has removed twitter typeahead for version 8: https://github.com/projectblacklight/blacklight/pull/2576
